Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Plantaricin Y (natural AMPs; bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; BWQ, unclassified)

Literature Information.Literature:
Strongly active against L. monocytogenes BCRC 14845, a fish pathogen. Diffusion assay: Active against L. monocytogenes BCRC 14845, L. sakei subsp. sakei BCRC 14622T, W. paramesenteroides BCRC 14006T, W. hellenica BCRC 80264T, W. minor BCRC 14049T, W. viridescens BCRC 11650T, L. lactis subsp. cremoris BCRC 12586T, L. taiwanensis BCRC 80460T, S. salivarius subsp. thermophilus BCRC 13869T, and B. subtilis subsp. subtilis BCRC 10255T.
Updated Jan2017; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Chen YS, Wang YC, Chow YS, Yanagida F, Liao CC, Chiu CM.2014
Literature Information.Title: Purification and characterization of plantaricin Y, a novel bacteriocin produced by Lactobacillus plantarum 510.
